sect2.title: Introduction to ImageMagick
sect2.para: ImageMagick is a collection of tools and libraries to read, write, and manipulate an image in various image formats. Image processing operations are available from the command line. Bindings to various programming languages are also available.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: ImageMagick contains animate, compare, composite, conjure, convert, display, identify, import, Magick-config, Magick++-config, mogrify, montage, Wand-config, libMagick, libMagick++ and libWand libraries, numerous delegate modules and the Image::Magick Perl module.

sect3.title: compare
sect3.para: Compares an image to a reconstructed image.

sect3.title: composite
sect3.para: Composites various images into the given base image.

sect3.title: conjure
sect3.para: Processes a Magick Scripting Language (MSL) script to create an image.

sect3.title: convert
sect3.para: Convert image(s) from one format to another.

sect3.title: identify
sect3.para: Describes the format and characteristics of an image file.

sect3.title: Magick-config and Magick++-config
sect3.para: Get information about the installed versions of ImageMagick and Magick++.

sect3.title: montage
sect3.para: Composites various images into a new image.

sect3.title: Wand-config
sect3.para: Get the options required to use the Wand library.

sect3.title: Image::Magick Perl module
sect3.para: The Image::Magic module allows the reading, manipulation and writing of a large number of image file formats using the ImageMagick library. Run make in the PerlMagick/demo directory of the package source tree to see a nice demo of the module's capabilities.
